meanings.definition: A style of wood paneling characterized by raised rectangular or square sections resembling folded linen.
meanings.sent1: The old castle had beautiful linenfold on the walls.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed intricate linenfold paneling from the Renaissance era.
meanings.sent3: The linenfold on the walls made the room feel cozy and elegant.
meanings.sent4: Her dress had a linenfold pattern that added a touch of sophistication.
meanings.sent5: The linenfold design gave the room a sense of history and tradition.

meanings.sent1: They decided to linenfold the entire dining room for a classic look.
meanings.sent2: She linenfolded the walls of her bedroom to create a vintage atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally linenfolded the ceiling instead of the walls, creating a unique effect.
meanings.sent4: The artist linenfolded the stage backdrop, transforming the theater into a grand hall.
meanings.sent5: Linenfolding the room brought a touch of elegance and charm to the space.
